intro: Cargillia flavocarpa, commonly known as the yellow-fruited cactus, is a unique member of the Cactaceae family. It is native to the arid regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and bright yellow fruit, which are adapted to thrive in harsh, dry environments. Its leaves are modified into spines, reducing water loss and providing protection from herbivores. The flowers, which are typically yellow or orange, bloom in the spring and attract pollinators such as bees and birds.
